paper_title: Sign changes of the partial sums of a random multiplicative function II
abstract: We study two models of random multiplicative functions: Rademacher random multiplicative functions supported on the squarefree integers $f$, and Rademacher random completely multiplicative functions $f^*$. We prove that the partial sums $\sum_{n\leq x}f^*(n)$ and $\sum_{n\leq x}\frac{f(n)}{\sqrt{n}}$ change sign infinitely often as $x\to\infty$, almost surely. The case $\sum_{n\leq x}\frac{f^*(n)}{\sqrt{n}}$ is left as an open question and we stress the possibility of only a finite number of sign changes, with positive probability.
